meanings.definition: To live in a state of inactivity or lack of growth.
meanings.sent1: The old tree vegetates quietly in the shade.
meanings.sent2: During winter, the bear vegetates in its den.
meanings.sent3: The lazy cat vegetates on the couch all day.
meanings.sent4: His creativity vegetates without any new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned garden vegetates, overrun by weeds.

meanings.definition: To lead a dull, monotonous existence.
meanings.sent1: She vegetates through life without any excitement.
meanings.sent2: The office worker vegetates in the same routine every day.
meanings.sent3: The robot vegetates in its programmed tasks.
meanings.sent4: His mind vegetates in a cycle of boredom.
meanings.sent5: The town vegetates in its quiet simplicity.

meanings.definition: To grow or sprout as a plant.
meanings.sent1: The seeds vegetate slowly in the fertile soil.
meanings.sent2: The flowers vegetate beautifully in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The plant vegetates happily under the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The vines vegetate and climb up the trellis.
meanings.sent5: The crops vegetate and thrive in the fields.
